snippet: Mr. Andrews, a drug dealer and robber who later counseled addicts and helped the government bring down a gang, inspired a character on “The Wire,” an acclaimed HBO drama.
abstract: Donnie Andrews, reformed stickup man whose story inspired the character Omar Little on the acclaimed HBO drama The Wire, dies at age 58.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Andrews, a drug dealer and robber who later counseled addicts and helped the government bring down a gang, inspired a character on “The Wire,” an acclaimed HBO drama.

headline.seo: Donnie Andrews, Basis for Omar of ‘The Wire,’ Dies at 58
headline.main: Donnie Andrews, the Real-Life Omar Little, Dies at 58
headline.print_headline: Donnie Andrews, 58, the Real-Life Omar Little
